subject: JUnit Test Suite With Eclipse 3.2.0
msgSnippet: I m having some problems with it. I m using JUnit 4 style of writing tests, with annotations. But somehow, when i try to create a testSuite, the GUI doesn t
messageBody:
I'm having some problems with it. I'm using JUnit 4 style of writing
tests, with annotations. But somehow, when i try to create a
testSuite, the GUI doesn't recognize any of the annotations. So, i
can't add any test to the suite method that eclipse creates.
The GUI only recognizes test classes that extends TestCase.
The tests run fine alone.
I searched the group messages and i saw someone with a similar (if not
same) problem.

So, what can i do? Ãµ.o
Any help is appreciated.

Thanks,
Leonardo Jr.

Some Code:
--

public class TestCalculator{

Calculator calculadora = new Calculator();

@Ignore("Not Ready Yet")
@Test
public void Sum() {
int a = 1;
int b = 2;
assertTrue(calculadora.sum(a, b)==a+b);
}

@Test
public void Muliplicar() {
//fail("Not yet implemented");
}

@Test
public void Dividir() {
double a=5;
double b=2;
assertTrue(calculadora.dividir(a,b)==a/b);
}

@Test
public void Subtrair() {
//fail("Not yet implemented");
}
-----------------------

Btw, i know that's a silly example, but i'm trying to learn the syntax
yet. :b
